g.text: Modeling methods outlined in this study provide economical assessments of heat stress
imposed by clothing, activities, and environments, that can be designed specifically for a given
S1 File. Measured thermal and evaporative resistances.
Authors acknowledge the helpful scientific guidance fromLaurie Blanchard, Karl Friedl, Reed
Hoyt, Timothy Rioux, and Alexander Welles. The authors would also like to thank the editor
and reviewers for helpful comments and Stephanie Arnett for help with the graphics. Highest
thanks to all of the men and women who have and continue to serve as healers and helpers in
The opinions or assertions contained herein are the private views of the authors and are not to
be construed as official or as reflecting the views of the Army or the Department of Defense.
